[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: Validate(ProposalInfo)] [Proposer Validation] No validation of proposal.Proposer field - can this be null or manipulated? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: Validate(ProposalInfo)] [Multiple Validation Calls] This function is called in multiple places - can inconsistent validation timing create security gaps? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Empty String Bypass] Line 117-118 returns true for empty strings, allowing proposals without description URLs - is this intended behavior? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [URI Parsing Exploit] Can an attacker craft malicious URIs that pass TryCreate but contain exploitable content (XSS, SSRF, etc.)? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Scheme Restriction] Only HTTP and HTTPS schemes are allowed - can this be bypassed with case variations or encoded characters? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Absolute URI Only] Only absolute URIs are accepted (UriKind.Absolute) - can relative URIs cause unexpected behavior if validation changes? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [URL Length] No length validation - can extremely long URLs cause DOS or storage issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Malicious Domains] No validation of domain reputation or blacklisting - can phishing/malicious URLs be used in proposals? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [State Access Race] Between retrieving proposal on line 126 and validating on line 128, can the proposal state be modified to bypass validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [Double Validation] This function calls Validate() which is also called elsewhere - can proposals become invalid between multiple validations? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [Null Proposal Exploit] Line 127 asserts proposal is not null but line 128 validates it - can a race condition between these lines be exploited? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Proposal validation happens at retrieval time, not execution time - can proposals expire or become invalid after retrieval? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetTokenInfo()] [External Call Security] Calls external TokenContract without validation - can malicious token contracts return manipulated data? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetTokenInfo()] [Return Value Validation] No validation that returned TokenInfo is complete or valid - can null/invalid token info cause downstream issues? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetTokenInfo()] [Symbol Validation] No validation of symbol parameter before making external call - can empty/malformed symbols cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Allowance Zero Check] Line 150 asserts allowance > 0, but what if allowance is negative due to integer underflow in the token contract? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Virtual Address Security] Uses GetProposalVirtualAddress which could be manipulated - can an attacker check allowances against wrong addresses? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Return Value Use] Returns allowance value but it's not clear how it's used - can stale allowance values cause security issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Allowance is checked but could change before actual token transfer - can this race condition be exploited? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Owner Validation] No validation that owner parameter is valid or authorized - can arbitrary allowance checks be performed? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Hash Collision] Line 156 uses either input.Token or ComputeFrom(input) - can an attacker craft inputs to create proposal ID collisions? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Token Nullability] If input.Token is null, falls back to HashHelper.ComputeFrom - can an attacker control which path is taken to manipulate proposal IDs? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Context.Self Binding] Uses Context.Self in generation - can proposal IDs be predicted or manipulated by external attackers? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Input Manipulation] If CreateProposalInput fields are attacker-controlled, can specific proposal IDs be generated to overwrite existing proposals? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [State Race Condition] Between checking proposal doesn't exist on line 163 and creating it on line 177, can another transaction create the same proposal? (High)
